1.4: The underside of each leaf is oddly sticky.

3.4: Exists in symbiosis with a colony of ants. The plant's stems are crawling with them.

4.4: The edges of its broad leaves are razor-sharp.

5.4: Transporting this species across government borders carries a hefty fine.

6.4: It doesn't trust you to water it.

7.4: The lush potted grass provides a good hiding spot for illicit items.

9.4: Packages the immense energy of lightning storms in a convenient format.

10.4: Cute bee vomit factories for your farm. The enslaved insects produce honey in all seasons but winter.

13.4: Turns ore and coal into metal bars. Is it big enough to fit a person inside?

16.4: Congeals microbe-riddled mammary liquids into a solidified mass.

17.4: Turns stolen sheep fur into fabric!

19.4: Squeezes the fat from organic materials to make lubricant. The mayor appreciates its work.

21.4: Advanced replicator technology. For better or for worse, it only works on shiny rocks.

24.4: Pulverizes unborn critters and blends them with oil to make sandwich spread.

25.4: Sucks the life from your crops so you can grow them anew.

28.4: A freshly harvested skeleton. Makes a useful tool for learning anatomy.

32.4: Stones like these are often used as landmarks or burial monuments.

33.4: Purely decorative. There's no one inside... wait...

34.4: Using this as decoration only would be dangerous blasphemy.

36.4: Unusually life-like. The material seems artificial, but you can't be sure.

37.4: Use an item on this to trap its image inside. The item won't be consumed.

38.4: Use an item on this to trap its image inside. The item won't be consumed.

46.4: Count the rings to learn how old this tree had grown before being killed.

47.4: It's best not to ask where this came from...

48.4: It changes form every season, but you're not sure how.

52.4: Medusa got to the poor critter.

53.4: Medusa got to the poor critter.

54.4: Medusa got to the poor critter.

55.4: Medusa got to the poor critter.

71.4: Hopefully the monsters chasing you won't know how to use stairs.

89.4: If you put your whole arm inside, you might be able to reach the bottom.

94.4: Emits a captivating melody. The longer you listen, the harder it is to look away.

98.4: Wh... where did the thing go that was inside it?

105.4: Handy tools to drain the life out of trees!

108.4: The flowers are so fragrant, they mask all other odors.

109.4: The flowers are so fragrant, they mask all other odors.

110.4: An unfortunate prince cursed into stasis. Collect them all! (1 of 8)

113.4: A miserable sorceress cursed into stasis. Collect them all! (2 of 8)

114.4: Burns once-living things into lumps of useful coal.

116.4: A shiny prop for your meager self-esteem.

117.4: Just enough to keep you coming back.

126.4: An ethereal being cursed into stasis. Collect them all! (3 of 8)

127.4: It seems to know the preferences of everyone in town...

130.4: Out of sight, out of mind.

136.4: A living sculpture cursed into stasis. Collect them all! (4 of 8)

137.4: A hapless farmer cursed into stasis. Collect them all! (5 of 8)

138.4: A live dwarf child cursed into stasis. Collect them all! (6 of 8)

139.4: An unlucky scavenger cursed into stasis. Collect them all! (7 of 8)

140.4: A possessed mask cursed into stasis. Collect them all! (8 of 8)

141.4: PARENTAL ADVISORY: may cause fits of frustration-induced violence.

143.4: Fends off the terrors of the night. Provides moderate light.

147.4: Only you can prevent forest fires. Provides moderate light.

149.4: No, this isn't a real skull... probably. Provides moderate light.

150.4: A fire in a wooden barrel sounds very safe. Provides moderate light.

154.4: Produces bait. Close the lid to give the worms some privacy.

156.4: Brings writhing, oozing creatures to life. Place slime eggs inside to hatch them.

158.4: Compresses slaughtered slime remains into a new life form.

159.4: The reward for thy suffering is more suffering.

160.4: Beware the curse. Too much iridium.

164.4: This statue would look good in purple shorts.

167.4: An aggregation of trapped souls, hostile enough to drive thieving creatures away from a distance (about 16 "tiles").

188.4: Dies and grows back every year, but it never seems to need water.

192.4: This artificial plant somehow changes with the seasons.

196.4: It's happiest in the hot sun of the desert.

200.4: An invasive species, this shrub causes colony collapse disorder in local bee populations.

209.4: Supposedly battery-powered, but the power source never seems to need replacement.

211.4: Breaks things down into tiny pieces. Meant for hardwood, but maybe a body would fit...

216.4: Not big enough for meat. Storing crops and forage ingredients will have to do.

507.1: Steel-toed to inflict hell on the shins of your enemies.

510.1: Keep your feet sweaty enough to be at risk of freezing even with the insulation.

511.1: Matte black leather boots that squish and scream as you walk.

512.1: Yeah, "fire" boots. They're covered in monster blood.

513.1: Nothing happens when they are rubbed.

806.1: A little tight on the toes.

15.2: The mayor's used silk shorts. They look better on you than on Marnie's floor.

1017.2: For holding up your lucky shorts.

1030.2: Complete with "secret stash" in the pocket.

1210.2: A couple spiders shake loose when you pick it up.

1217.2: It smells strongly of sour milk.

1239.2: Remember: you go down with your ship.

1275.2: Dust thou art, and to dust thou shalt return...

19.1: M'lady, may I take your chair, bitch?

24.1: It feels damp against your eyelid when you wear it. Smells odd.

31.1: Me gonna be deaf now, poke.

41.1: 100% organic. Emily made it with her love... I don't want to know from what.

67.1: Sharp spines pierce your face whenever you put it on. It's uncomfortable.

16.5: A hotly pungent, fleshy root. Crushing or grinding it releases the flavor and heat.

20.5: Some wild animal marked its territory on this one.

22.5: The leaves are a powerful diuretic; eating them increases urine production.

24.5: It has all the flavor of a bleached, long-dead carrot.

60.5: This gem is thought to guard against memory loss. A thoughtful gift for divorcees.

62.5: Thought to protect against seasickness and tragic sailing accidents.

64.5: The "pigeon's blood" variety of this gem is its most sought-after color variant.

66.5: Some sources suggest that this stone is used to stabilize mental disorders.

68.5: When worn as a necklace, this gemstone is believed to drive away sadness.

70.5: In many cultures, this stone has a strong association with the dead.

71.5: The mayor's used silk shorts. They look better on you than on Marnie's floor.

72.5: This one seems to be clear of blood.

78.5: A dirtier variety of carrot. Fulfills many needs of a miner.

84.5: The last remnant of some long forgotten creature.

86.5: An item commonly gifted by cheapskates.

88.5: Covered in rough hair, it provides both milk and meat.

90.5: You'd have to spend a long time under the desert sun to consider this fruit edible.

93.5: Flickers suddenly from time to time, even when there is no breeze.

96.5: A scroll written in an ancient language... it probably isn't calling for genocide of surface dwellers, right?

97.5: A scroll written in an ancient language, describing a species that never expected to become endangered.

98.5: A scroll written in an ancient language, the writer unaware their days were numbered.

99.5: A scroll written in an ancient language. Did they know the end was coming?

100.5: Hopefully not used in any sacrificial rituals.

103.5: When left out of sight, this doll is rumored to change position on its own.

104.5: Legend says they are enchanted to be as warm as their owners. It's cold to the touch.

105.5: You can still taste what the last person who used it had for lunch.

107.5: Perhaps it can still hatch... what could go wrong?

109.5: The sword may be in bad shape, but it has far outlived its owner.

110.5: Despite its normal shape, I wouldn't use it for breakfast.

112.5: It reminds you of your old workplace, somehow.

113.5: A mummified chicken in pristine condition. When you shake it you can hear small bones rattling inside.

116.5: Some believe that starfish scream as the sun dries them out, but only fish can hear their piercing cries.

119.5: Imagine blowing some ancient creature's dirty, bacteria-filled tibia. Bone flute!

121.5: It's sturdy, but even the best armor didn't prevent their near-extinction.

122.5: The strange crystalline screen stays lit, but shows only static.

123.5: Looks like skin stretched over bone. Nice sound though.

126.5: It just wants to spend your whole life with you.

127.5: What a beautiful smile you have.

128.5: Expands to stab with poisonous spines when threatened. Its cousin, the pufferchick, is much more friendly.

129.5: Suspected of ruining many a soup.

139.5: In fall, these fish swim miles upstream and die just to mate.

143.5: This ugly bottom-feeder will eat just about anything.

148.5: Wriggles and writhes just like some long organ.

149.5: The tentacles give a tingly, suckling sensation.

151.5: These soft-bodied animals are known to be incredibly intelligent. Still, delicious.

153.5: The consistency of cold snot, with the occasional satisfying crunch.

156.5: Should have left it in the water...

157.5: It leaves a fragrant white film on your hands.

160.5: This eerie fish is known for the sexual parasitism of its disturbing reproductive cycle.

161.5: A frozen, zombified fish. Don't let it bite you. You might be able to use it as a weapon, though.

162.5: Legend says it survives by feeding off the remains of travelers who drown in the mines.

163.5: The grandfather of all largemouth bass in the lake, now torn from his home.

164.5: It hides using camouflage. Sometimes you can see the sand move as it waits for prey.

165.5: The unholy union of a scorpion and a carp. Keep hands away from tailfin!

166.5: Many of the coins inside are stained an ugly dark red, almost black.

167.5: Food safety authorities have questioned the blue chemical used to color this drink.

169.5: The weathered remnant of a drowned tree.

171.5: Faded blue marker on one side mentions "blackmail", but the rest is indiscernible.

172.5: Filled with propaganda and word vomit. Worthless.

176.5: A regular white egg. Fresh from a chicken's cloaca!

174.5: An uncommonly large white egg. Can you imagine how the chicken must have stretched?

178.5: Delicious grass corpses for your animal friends.

180.5: A regular brown egg. Fresh from a chicken's cloaca!

182.5: An uncommonly large brown egg. Can you imagine how the chicken must have stretched?

184.5: A jug of cow tiddy juice. Yum.

186.5: Voluminous secretions from a bulging cow udder.

192.5: It doesn't seem like much, but you'd be glad of it in a famine.

194.5: Mmm~ unborn chicken cooked in crushed nut juice.

195.5: Fluffy, congealed cow AND chicken juices. Are you gonna eat that?

196.5: Assorted dismembered plant materials, tossed with a flavorful dressing.

197.5: Plants taste better with curdled cow juice on them.

201.5: This would make a very satisfying last meal.

202.5: The sapient flesh is deliciously chewy.

203.5: What's inside? OH SWEET YOBA IT'S SPIDERS!

204.5: So tasty that luck-bringing spirits will nest in your belly to eat it.

205.5: You can still taste the dirt.

208.5: If you can't stomach eating your vegetables, drown them in sugar first.

209.5: The carp is not the surprising part of this meal.

212.5: Cooked flesh of a fish with a squirt of something yellow... thats what makes it special. ;)

213.5: A fishy smell is normal for this taco.

216.5: The greatest thing since the elves disappeared.

225.5: Greasy on the outside and mushy on the inside. At least it's no longer slimy.

233.5: The taste brings to mind screaming children.

238.5: The gelatinized corpses of countless cranberries. How could you?!

239.5: Oh, you'll be stuffed, all right.

241.5: A vegetarian alternative for the health-conscious cannibal.

247.5: A vital ingredient in fried food and clogged arteries.

253.5: Causes irregular or rapid heartbeat in high doses. Just ignore it, it's probably fine.

256.5: Belongs to the nightshade family, but don't worry, it's not poisonous.

261.5: Warps all time and space to re-center Calico Desert on your current physical location. Consumed on use.

271.5: May cause avian stomachs to explode when eaten.

275.5: Be careful breaking this open. You could get an artifact... or unleash a very angry specter.

279.5: Colorful candy made from literal rocks. Seems like something meant to trick children.

283.5: Crisp and juicy berries. Alas, some things are only edible once.

286.5: A small explosive device that is unfortunately tempting for small children.

287.5: A civilian version of a mass-produced explosive from the Gotoro war.

288.5: A devastatingly powerful bomb intended to inflict maximum damage and harm.

293.5: Chunks of brick can make decent weapons, in a pinch. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.

296.5: The color is eerily similar to salmon... eggs.

297.5: Plant this for your animals to eat. When you scythe it, you can smell the grass screaming in pain as it dies.

298.5: Makes a stronger prison than an iron fence.

300.5: A purple grain like a thousand years old. Good luck actually enjoying this dust.

303.5: Drink before and after driving a bus if your name is Pam.

305.5: Might give birth to the Darkness itself. Do you dare to let it hatch?

306.5: Technically an oily egg yolk. Someone came up with this great idea!

307.5: Spreadable essence of unborn duck. Goes great in sandwiches.

308.5: Your mortal, dimensionally finite stomach cannot hope to endure its unfathomable nutrients.

310.5: A winged tree seed that bears uncanny resemblance to an insect.

311.5: Tiny ants crawl between the rough scales.

323.5: Makes a stronger prison than a wood fence.

324.5: Makes a stronger prison than a stone fence.

330.5: Not very tasty, 0 out of 10. (2 out of 10 with rice)

331.5: Deliberately crafted to give a haunted look. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.

333.5: Has an unnaturally smooth surface. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.

340.5: Bee spit. The bees use it to feed their young, so it should be fine for human consumption, right?

342.5: Jar of soggy vegetables left to cure in a pool of brine.

346.5: Mm, you can really taste how old this liquid is!

349.5: This drug will give you the 'youthful' energy to go all night long!

350.5: Life-blood squeezed from vegetables for easy-to-drink vitamins!

368.5: Your crops have a slight chance to grow larger in soil sprinkled with tree blood.

369.5: Improves the chance of higher quality harvests by repurposing dead fish.

372.5: Taking home invasion to new heights.

378.5: Choking hazard: Not for children under 3 years.

382.5: A bit of magic and fire has turned old bones to coal. Should be safe to use.

390.5: The most ancient and versatile of all weapons and tools.

395.5: Brown, bitter liquid made from straining hot water through burnt, pulverized seeds.

396.5: Contains orbs of pungent flesh that burst when prodded.

398.5: With skins peeled they feel like wet eyeballs.

401.5: Toss dead grass around for a nice fall look.

404.5: Someday they will decompose *your* remains. If you must eat, chew gently.

405.5: Decorate with milled tree carcasses. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.

407.5: Small, sharp rocks to step on. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.

409.5: Falling on this surface risks a thousand cuts. Place on the ground to create paths or floors.

413.5: You can see the embryo of a baby slime bouncing within. Hatch it in a slime incubator.

420.5: Poisonous. But fun to eat anyway.

422.5: Brightly colored. They say this one isn't poisonous, so it should be safe to eat.

424.5: Cow milk exposed to bacteria and allowed to curdle. Eat up!

426.5: Squishy, congealed milk from a goat's udder. Considered a delicacy by many.

433.5: Grows in spring and summer; reharvestable. Whatever you do, don't stuff it up your nose.

436.5: If cow lactations aren't your thing, try this variant!

437.5: It only takes 100 slime carcasses to make one of these. Hatch it in a slime incubator.

438.5: The goat's swollen udder must feel much better after squeezing all of this out.

439.5: A developing youngling of the most dangerous variety of slime monster. Hatch it in a slime incubator.

440.5: That sheep will be cold and shivering, but sure, enjoy how soft this is!

441.5: Owing to improper storage, it causes hundreds of unfortunate child deaths each year.

444.5: This exquisite feather was plucked out of a duck's butt.

446.5: A successful amputation from a peculiar rabbit species that seems to regrow lost feet.

447.5: Aged fish fetuses covered in a thick, gooey substance. The salt brings out the flavor.

454.5: There's no evidence to confirm that this fruit could harbor an ancient, long-dormant disease.

456.5: It's a 'little' slimy. As in 'slimy to the point where you're eating more slime than soup'.

457.5: Very similar to algae soup with the additional flavour of rotten eggs.

458.5: A colorful bunch of severed plant reproductive organs. Maybe your sweetheart will get the hint?

460.5: A ghost ripped this from a mermaid so you can woo your lover.

463.5: Beating this to a specific pattern might just awaken the wrong god.

464.5: Go ahead. Play your haunting melodies, see what happens.

465.5: Increases growth rate by at least 10%. You have to wonder if this would work on other things.

473.5: It doesn't *feel* magical, but you never know. Plant in spring, 10 days, reharvestable. Trellis crop.

475.5: The package says "seeds", but these are clearly potato eyes. Plant in spring, 6 days. Chance for multiple harvest.

516.5: You wonder where the light comes from. Could this ring be radioactive?

517.5: Emits a strong, constant light. Wearing it makes your head feel funny...

518.5: Makes you a little more alluring to the objects in your surroundings.

519.5: Everything is fiercely attracted to you. You're just that irresistible.

520.5: You won't feel a thing from the slimes' touch. ;)

521.5: The sharp edges cut into your flesh, making this ring difficult to remove. But it makes you feel stronger...

522.5: It can steal the life-force of any being; hopefully not your own.

523.5: Wearing this ring overwhelms you with a sudden blood-lust.

524.5: Lets Yoba watch over you as you fight. Maybe just a little too closely...

526.5: Improves your skills of thievery from corpses.

527.5: Just as uncomfortable as it looks.

529.5: Push everything and everyone further away from you.

530.5: Gleams yellow when worn; an unseen force adjusts the movements of your hand.

533.5: Kill things faster than ever before.

535.5: Ask a blacksmith to shatter this poor rock, then toss it aside for the treasure within.

536.5: Ask a blacksmith to shatter this poor rock, then toss it aside for the treasure within.

537.5: Ask a blacksmith to shatter this poor rock, then toss it aside for the treasure within.

544.5: The crystals glow bright green when stimulated. Stimulated how?

545.5: Small amounts are found in human teeth. Tiny crystals... growing... in your mouth bones...

552.5: A toxic mineral. Please do not insert it into any orifices.

553.5: Reflected in its jet-black surface you can see your face... and another face behind you.

554.5: Dwarves are said to use the powdered crystal both medicinally and recreationally.

556.5: An attractive variety of arsenic mineral. Used in folk medicine, but highly toxic.

557.5: This slime has seen some things. It's best we leave it this way.

559.5: Did you think this was gold? Sucker!

561.5: You hear strange moans in the distance when holding this crystal.

562.5: Some poor tiger was blinded for this...

571.5: Heat it at high temperatures to produce a compound helpful for disposing of human remains.

572.5: This stone can be easily carved into all sorts of tempting shapes.

575.5: Can be crafted into thin blades much sharper than glass. Useful for surgeries.

582.5: This bone's age is about one thous... Oh! ...Oh no. It's much more recent.

586.5: Better to collect fossils than the actual creature. They're almost extinct.

587.5: Formed eons ago when a small creature fell into a mud pit and was swallowed alive by the dirt.

599.5: Spits on the 4 adjacent tiles every morning.

376.5: A sweet-smelling flower thought to symbolize death. Breathing its scent is almost addictive...

604.5: Every proper holiday needs a flaming dessert.

613.5: How many worms are in this one?

614.5: A highly diluted mixture of shrub and water. Yum!

648.5: It's very "healthy". Tastes like eating sliced up cardboard with mayonnaise.

651.5: It has a soothing effect, just like the opium that can be derived from poppy seeds.

634.5: Take care not to choke on the hard pit.

636.5: Fuzzy to the touch with soft, sweet flesh underneath.

637.5: A known aphrodisiac with an inside texture like tiny, crunchy eyeballs.

638.5: A popular modder known for creating Train Station mod and Shop Tile Framework.

680.5: It squirms within your grasp, the embryo eagerly awaiting release. Hatch it in a slime incubator.

681.5: Activate it to play god and wreck havoc on natural weather patterns. Consumed on use.

684.5: Throw this on the grill for a late night treat!

685.5: Large bugs, slain and minced to lure in more critters for food.

688.5: Warps all time and space to re-center the farm on your current physical location. Consumed on use.

689.5: Warps all time and space to re-center the mountains on your current physical location. Consumed on use.

690.5: Warps all time and space to re-center the beach on your current physical location. Consumed on use.

691.5: Stab the fish when they bite the hook, stab them again when they try to wiggle free.

694.5: Helps thwart a hooked fish's efforts to escape.

698.5: Slow-breeding bottom-feeder close to extinction. Now there's one less in the wild, courtesy of you.

699.5: Doomed to be the last of their bloodline, these unnatural hybrids can never reproduce.

702.5: This freshwater fish is at half-mast.

708.5: Born with an eye on each side of its head, one eye slowly migrates across as it grows.

709.5: A formidable length of hardened wood. Very pleasing to the touch.

717.5: A sea spider, ready to be boiled alive and eaten fresh.

723.5: A slimy-feeling shell means this creature is still alive.

724.5: The sweet life-blood of maple trees, extracted for consumption.

725.5: The innards of an oak tree, extracted and processed for use.

730.5: Some say you can hear the lobster scream as it is boiled alive. Others say it is just the sound of steam escaping.

729.5: It may have a fancy French name, but it's still just snails.

746.5: Vegetable craniotomy victim. Place its leering skull in a visible location as a warning to others.

747.5: Flies have laid eggs in the putrid mass. You should probably get rid of this.

748.5: Something wriggles just under the surface. You should probably get rid of this.

749.5: Ask a blacksmith to shatter this poor rock, then toss it aside for the treasure within. So many possibilities!

766.5: You're not sure which organ this gelatinous substance is from.

767.5: It's still twitching after being sliced off from the body.

768.5: A warm remnant of Yoba's power.

770.5: There's a little bit of everything in here! Not just seeds... there's a few dead bugs and animal droppings, too.

771.5: Better check it for animal droppings.

772.5: You'll ooze garlic from every pore, producing a pungent odor that is frightful to weaker monsters.

774.5: Bug corpses held together with Linus' special sauce.

788.5: The axe cries out for its owner. Faintly you can hear it whisper, "Robin..."

790.5: Stained with what you *hope* is berry juice. It smells like Linus, and he smells awful.

795.5: Shadows have mutated this species beyond repair. Keep an eye out behind you, you could be next.

797.5: A grain of sand that irritated an oyster until it spit on it again, and again, and again. Very beautiful.

800.5: A fish rapidly pulled from its deep-sea home. The changing pressures have almost turned it inside-out.

801.5: Binds your partner's soul to yours, 'til death do you part.

802.5: Grows a spiny plant with a nasty defense system. Plant indoors only, 12 days, reharvestable.

809.5: Sit with strangers in the dark and pretend the room isn't gassed up with farts. Give one to a friend!

810.5: The enchanted shell might protect you, but it certainly didn't protect the crab.

811.5: Explodes enemy corpses. Violently. Wear it on a finger!

812.5: You can see tiny baby fish inside. Alive and wiggling. Age them in a preserves jar to bring out more flavor.

445.5: The salted, unborn offspring of an endangered fish species. A luxurious delicacy!

267.5: Two eyes on one side of its head and none on the other. It wasn't born that way.

265.5: Waterlogged and briny. There's no going back if you eat this.

1.1: Helpful when the howls you hear aren't just ordinary howls.

4.1: You wield the power of the universe in your hands. Don't drop it.

5.1: Some dead person's bone, sharpened into a crude but piercing sword.

8.1: Sharp enough that its deadly cuts can barely be felt by the victim.

9.1: Cuts and cauterizes in one stroke.

10.1: It's strong enough to cut through heavy armor.

12.1: What a weak sword. You might as well scream "Kill me!" instead.

13.1: Insect guts and a decapitated head. Kill monsters with their own kind.

14.1: You'll be in for a world of trouble if Neptune ever comes back for it.

15.1: Even the trees are conspiring to bloodshed.

16.1: Melt through bones like butter with this knife!

17.1: Concealed and deadly. A weapon made for treachery.

18.1: Made it myself back in my prison days. Wonder how it got here?

22.1: Unusually light in your hands and on your conscience.

23.1: Tears holes in the space-time continuum if used improperly.

24.1: A crudely shaped club. The heavy end is pockmarked and matted with blood and hair.

26.1: The material is toxic when ingested.

27.1: Repurposed equipment from a children's game.

28.1: With this gavel in hand you can be judge, jury and executioner.

29.1: Swinging this too hard could have cosmic repercussions.

31.1: Stolen from the guy in the basement.

32.1: Hit the eyes and crush it! Yes! Requires ammo.

33.1: Adds extra strength to deliver a nice clear hole in the head. Requires ammo.

43.1: Stained with the blood of several mutinies.

44.1: Severs bodies from souls with panache!

47.1: Cuts grass... and souls. Yields hay if you've built a silo.

51.1: A relic of the merfolk wars.

53.1: From the hands of the Reaper himself!

Entries.Axe.cs.14019: A perfect tool for chopping trees and stealing kneecaps.
Entries.Pickaxe.cs.14185: Swing to puncture through stones, debris, or almost anything else.
Entries.Hoe.cs.14102: Digs and tills soil. Don't waste your gold on it.
Entries.WateringCan.cs.14325: Used to water crops and revive drunkards. It can be refilled at any water source.
Entries.TrashCan_Description: Reduce, reuse, recycle... or not. Reclaims {0}% of the value from trashed items.
Entries.Pan.cs.14181: Dredge through muddy water in search of scant treasure, if you're that desperate.
Entries.MilkPail.cs.14168: Collect warm mammary excretions from your livestock.
Entries.FishingRod.cs.14042: Used to drag unsuspecting fish to their deaths. A fun and relaxing pastime.
Entries.FishingRod.cs.trainingRodDescription: Too incompetent to use a normal fishing rod, huh? Sucks to be you.
Entries.Shears.cs.14241: Strip sheep naked to steal their wool.
